page.title: 11SYKEHOUSE LOCK
page.content: WE DROVE TO SEE MR HACKNER THE KEEPER OF SYKEHOUSE LOCK. WE ASKED MR HACKNER A FEW QUESTIONS ABOUT THE LOCK AND THE CANAL. WE ASKED HIM HOW MANY BOATS COME PAST IN A DAY. HE SAID IT DEPENDS WHICH DAY. ON WEEKENDS WE GET ABOUT FORTY PLEASURE CRUISERS OR ON WEEKDAYS TANKERS COMING FROM GOOLE CARRYING HUNDREDS OF TONS OF STEEL. THE ACTUAL SIZE OF THE LOCK IS 25 METRES LONG AND ABOUT 4 METRES DEEP. THE CANAL IS ABOUT 4 METRES DEEP AND 40 MILES LONG. THE CANAL IS CALLED THE NEW JUNCTION CANAL BECAUSE IT LINKS UP TWO MORE CANALS. THESE ARE THE SHEFFIELD AND SOUTH YORKSHIRE NAVIGATION CANAL AND THE OTHER IS CALLED THE AIRE AND CALDER. MR HACKNER SAID THE ORIGINAL CANAL WAS BUILT IN 1900 AND THE LOCK WAS MODERNISED IN 1981. WE TOOK A FEW PHOTOGRAPHS OF THE LOCK AND MR HACKNER AND THEN THANKED HIM AND SAID GOODBYE.
